result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J A Davy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael J A Davy is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael J A Davy was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court costs remitted. $342 to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 6 months. Court authorized payment plan.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael J A Davy

records.addlTxt: Copy of minutes from PLEAS Hrg on 11/3/22 sent electronically to DCJ.
Payment info sent to defendant at DCJ
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

10:21 AM Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count(s) 1.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count #2 and repeater to Count 1. 

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT # 1
The Court sentences Defendant to:
-Serve 30 in Dane County Jail

-Days credit for time served:  30
-Days credit to jail: 30
Sentenced Deemed served

COURT COSTS:
Ct #1 
- VW & DNA surcharge due w/in 6 months. Payment plan approved
- All other court costs waived. 


-DNA on file


-Defendant advised of post-conviction rights

[Renee Treasure]
Court entered not guilty plea for defendant. Motions due 20 days. Bail continued.

9:40 AM Defendant Michael J A Davy in court, in custody.  Attorney Tim Verhoff in court for State of Wisconsin. DE states he wishes to proceed Pro Se for today's and future hearings. DE duly sworn. Court has colloquy with DE. DE fills out waiver of right to counsel. Court takes recess for DA to discuss case with DE. Back on the record, DE completes PLQ. Court advised DE of right to and waived preliminary hearing. 

DA gives update, states agreement has been reached; DE to enter guilty plea to Ct. 1; state will move to dismiss repeater and Ct. 1 outright; DE to be sentenced to 30 days which will be deemed time served. Court has colloquy with DE re: agreement. DE advised of right to and waived preliminary hearing. Court finds PC for Bindover.
Defendant in DCJ.  Journey Mental health sent drug court intake paperwork to court liaison for defendant to complete and returned to Journey Mental Health.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial Judge - Br 11

1:40 PM Defendant Michael J A Davy in court, in custody.  Attorney Crystal A Vera in court for Michael J A Davy.  Prosecuting attorney Tim Helmberger in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. Defendant referred for screening.
Status conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 3, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 3, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on October 31, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
